title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 20
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Ye'll be from Leadburn, I'm thinkin'?"

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 20
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Ye'll be from Leadburn, I'm thinkin'?"

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: At Leadburn was the inn where I had first met my servant Nicol, mytrusty comrade through so many varying fates.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: Soin a little, when the lights of Penicuik were well on the left, I cameto the Hawes Burn, which passes the Inn of Leadburn, and tracking itdownward, came to the bald white house which does duty for a hostel.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: And see, gin ye tak my advice and gin ye're gaun toBarns, gang off the Peebles road at Leadburn, and haud doun by theBrochtoun and Newlands ways, for a' the way atween Leadburn and Peeblesis hotchin' wi' sodgers and what-ye-may-ca'-thems.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: And see, gin ye tak my advice and gin ye're gaun toBarns, gang off the Peebles road at Leadburn, and haud doun by theBrochtoun and Newlands ways, for a' the way atween Leadburn and Peeblesis hotchin' wi' sodgers and what-ye-may-ca'-thems.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: I came to Leadburn about eleven o'clock in the forenoon, somewhat coldin body, but brisk and comforted in spirit.

title: John Burnet of Barns: A Romance
author: Buchan, John
snippet: I scarce delayed inEddleston, but pushed on up the valley, expecting to get dinner at theinn at Leadburn, which stands at the watershed, just where the county ofEdinburgh touches our shire of Tweeddale.

title: Spare Hours
author: Brown, John
snippet: She told me that one day she sawJames coming down from Leadburn with the cart; he had been away west,getting eggs and butter, cheese and hens for Edinburgh.
